abstract: General Electric is said to be near a deal to buy Abbott Laboratories’ medical diagnostics unit for as much as $5 billion.
snippet: General Electric is said to be near a deal to buy Abbott Laboratories’ medical diagnostics unit for as much as $5 billion.
lead_paragraph: General Electric is near a deal to buy Abbott Laboratories’ medical diagnostics unit for as much as $5 billion, according to people involved in the negotiations.

headline.main: G.E. May Buy Abbott’s Diagnostic Unit
headline.print_headline: G.E. May Buy Abbott’s Diagnostic Unit

byline.original: By ANDREW ROSS SORKIN  and CLAUDIA DEUTSCH

abstract: General Electric is near a deal to buy Abbott Laboratories‘ medical diagnostics unit for as much as $5 billion, according to The New York Times. Acquiring the Abbott business, which makes and sells glucose monitoring systems, blood test kits and other chemically based diagnostic tools, would enable G.E.’s health care unit to expand its growing stable of diagnostic products and services.
lead_paragraph: General Electric is near a deal to buy Abbott Laboratories‘ medical diagnostics unit for as much as $5 billion, according to The New York Times. Acquiring the Abbott business, which makes and sells glucose monitoring systems, blood test kits and other chemically based diagnostic tools, would enable G.E.’s health care unit to expand its growing stable of diagnostic products and services.

headline.main: G.E. May Buy Abbott’s Diagnostic Unit

abstract: General Electric will buy Abbott‘s laboratory diagnostics business for $8.13 billion in cash, the two companies announced Thursday afternoon. The acquisition will strengthen G.E.’s own burgeoning diagnostics business as it absorbs the Abbott units. The sale does not include Abbott’s lucrative molecular diagnostics and glucose monitoring businesses.
lead_paragraph: General Electric will buy Abbott‘s laboratory diagnostics business for $8.13 billion in cash, the two companies announced Thursday afternoon. The acquisition will strengthen G.E.’s own burgeoning diagnostics business as it absorbs the Abbott units. The sale does not include Abbott’s lucrative molecular diagnostics and glucose monitoring businesses.

headline.main: G.E. Buys Abbott’s Diagnostics Unit for $8.13 Billion
